To whom do we cry? See, we see what happened in Genesis 41 when those seven years of dearth began. It was immediate and severe. We find that the people, they cried out, and I understand why they cried out. They cried out to Pharaoh. And Pharaoh and Ensign said, I can't help you. Go to Joseph, and whatsoever he sayeth, do it. What he sayeth to you, do. If we look at these types this evening, for us in 2023, almost 2024 now, we have times of crisis and difficulty. To whom do we flee? To whom do we go? Don't go to Egypt. Don't go to the world. The world doesn't have anything to offer you. Go to God. Seek God. And whatever God says, do it. Do it. You know that we do not have to pray about what God has revealed for us to do in his word. You know what I mean by that? When God tells us to do something, we don't say, well, you know, I'm gonna pray about that. When God says that we're to rejoice in everything, give thanks for this will of God and Christ Jesus concerning you, I'm gonna pray about that. No, no, no, just do it. Amen? You don't have to pray about whether you're gonna, you don't have to pray about whether you're gonna give. You don't have to pray whether you're gonna go to church. You don't have to pray. We're commanded to do those things. We don't pray about the commands. Does that make sense? We just do them. We just obey. And God will bless. See, God's way is not always our way. But you know what God wants us to do? He wants us to trust him. He is the almighty. He is the one that spoke everything into existence. He is the one that saved your soul. You understand that there's nothing you can do tonight to get to heaven on your own. We all agree on that. There's nothing we can do to get to heaven on our own. We need Jesus. Would you agree? But you know what happens sometimes for living tomorrow? We think, I got this. I can handle tomorrow. I mean, I can't handle eternity, but I can handle tomorrow. I can handle this week. And we live independently of God. And that just makes zero sense. Listen, if you can trust him with your eternal destiny, you can trust him with your tomorrow. Amen? If you can trust him with your eternal destiny, you can trust him with tomorrow. Whatsoever he sayeth unto you, do it. To whom do we cry? To whom do we go in times of crisis? We all face them. We all have times of great difficulty. And I hope tonight that we run to the cross. that we run to the Lord Jesus Christ and we say, Lord, help me. You ever read Psalm 12? Help, Lord. That's how it begins. You know, sometimes that's all we can pray. Help, Lord. I just need help and I know that you're the helper and you said that you would give us help. Aren't you so thankful that we have a wonderful Savior and He offers to give us the counsel, the direction that we need. He's our shepherd and as our shepherd, He takes good care of His sheep. Let's pray this evening. Father, we love You. We thank You for loving us. We thank You for Your Word, the truth contained therein. I pray that even as we look at this historical event, this time in Egypt when Joseph is there and this famine begins and the land is famished, Lord, I pray that tonight as we can understand the historical context of this event that we also would be able to make application in our lives. Lord, I pray that You'd help us tonight to run to You in times of difficulty, of great need, of great distress, times of crisis. Help us, Lord, not to run to the world, the world system. Help us, Lord, to trust You, to obey You. I pray that You'd help us, Lord, to be doers of the Word and not hearers only. Help us to have a heart of surrender and submission to You and to Your Word. I pray that in these few moments of invitation that You'd have Your will and way that You would move and work in hearts and lives as only You can. We'll thank You for what You'll do. For it's in Christ's name we pray.
